title: Prince Harry told Meghan Markle she 'looked amazing' before awards
text:
Prince Harry reassured Meghan that she 'looks amazing' after giving birth to her first child in a touching exchange during last night's WellChild Awards.

Meghan, 38, re-wore the £462 green fitted P.A.R.O.S.H dress she first showcased during her engagement interview for the event, where she and Harry met award-winners including Emmie Narayan-Nicholas, 10, from Manchester.

Recalling her conversation with the royals to Town and Country, Emmie said that she told Meghan 'you look amazing and you've just had a baby'.

She continued: He looked at her and went "See I told you!" in a way that we would...It did feel like they were very down to earth.'

Prince Harry, 35, reassured Meghan Markle, 38, she looked 'amazing' postpartum ahead of her appearance at the WellChild Awards last night, when she donned a dress she'd originally worn two years ago

A guest at the WellChild Awards revealed the intimate moment between the couple, in which Prince Harry assured Meghan she 'looked amazing' postpartum

The WellChild Awards celebrates the inspiring qualities of some of the country’s seriously ill young people and the dedication of those who go the extra mile to keep children healthy and happy, including the outstanding health, social care and education professionals.

Meghan looked glamorous at the event as she wore a £1,185 camel coat by Sentaler, draped over her green dress by P.A.R.O.S.H.

The fitted sleeveless dress features a round neck and bow detail, while she matched her outfit with a £688 tortoiseshell scarf bag and light brown £562 Manolo Blahnik heels.

The Duchess wore her long locks down and slightly wavy as she arrived at the event with Prince Harry - who became Patron of WellChild in 2007.

The Duchess recycled a £462 fitted green wool dress by P.A.R.O.S.H. for the event last night, marking the first time she has reworn something from before her pregnancy with baby Archie

Meghan had initially worn the fitted green wool dress for her engagement interview with Prince Harry in 2017

Meghan originally wore the fitted green dress two years ago, during her engagement interview with Prince Harry.

While Meghan has been recycling several outfits recently, this occasion marked the first time since giving birth that the Duchess has re-worn an outfit from before she was pregnant with Archie.

Their appearance comes after their 10 day tour of Africa - where they visited Cape Town, Angola, Malawi and Botswana - and took their son Archie with them.

During the tour Meghan recycled several outfits she had originally worn in her early pregnancy with baby Archie.

The royal is said to have reassured his wife that she 'looked amazing' ahead of the awards evening

Prince Harry reportedly said 'I told you!' after an award winner told Meghan 'you look amazing and you've just had a baby'

Prince Harry and Meghan met with award winners throughout the evening, including Emmie Narayan-Nicholas, 10, from Manchester (pictured, first child on the left, second row)

At one event in, she wore £525 Veronica Beard 'Cary' Dress, which she had initially wore in Tonga in October 2018.

At another she donned a recycled stripey maxi dress that she previously wore on her and Prince Harry's tour of Australia in October 2018 to attend a Reception for Young People at the Residence of the British High Commissioner in Cape Town.

Emmie, who was awarded at the event for her idea, Emmie’s Kitchen.

She was diagnosed with Leukemia in 2017 and while being treated in the hospital, she envisioned a place where parents of sick children could meet and chat while enjoying a three-course meal.

Prince Harry reportedly told Meghan she 'looked amazing' ahead of the award ceremony last night

Emmie's Kitchen has now fed roughly 1,500 people.

Emmie's mother Eve went on to describe the Sussexes as 'very cool and down to earth' during their chat with the award winner.

She added: 'I guess for my child it’s somebody as a role model and inspiration for her that she’s a strong, mixed race woman who is part of the establishment. When I was growing up that didn’t exist.'
description: Prince Harry, 35, reassured Meghan Markle, 38, that she 'looked amazing' ahead of  the WellChild Awards in London last night, as they chatted to one of the young winners.
